5th Kimilsungia Festival to open
    Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The 5th Kimilsungia Festival will open in Pyongyang on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, the birthday of President Kim Il Sung.
 The festival will be held at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia exhibition from April 11, Juche 92 (2003) under the sponsorship of the organizing committee of the Kimilsungia festival.    
 Ministries, national institutions, organs of armed forces and all other units across the country, individual working people who are cultivating Kimilsungia, overseas compatriots, foreign flower experts and fans will participate in the festival  the festival will decorate the April holiday, the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung, as a flower festival praising the great man and contribute to exchanging scientific and technological achievements and experience gained in cultivating and disseminating Kimilsungia.

articles.content:
Dangerous U.S.-Japan military nexus under fire
    Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is reportedly contemplating the strengthened anti-DPRK cooperation system by plugging Japan into an aerial espionage against the DPRK.
 The U.S. recently requested Japan to let airborne warning and control plane e-767 of its air "self-defence force" to fly above waters off the Korean Peninsula to watch it under the pretext of "ensuring security" of the U.S. electronic reconnaissance plane monitoring the DPRK's moves.    
 Disclosing this fact the March 20th issue of Tokyo Shimbun said the introduction of the ASDF's airborne warning and control plane equipped with a system of sharing information with u.s. reconnaissance planes and warships would actually mean U.S.-Japan joint operation.

articles.content:
Greetings to Pakistani President
    Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Pervez Musharraf, President of Pakistan, on the occasion of the Day of Pakistan, auspicious holiday of the Pakistani people.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the president and people of Pakistan greater success in the work for the development and prosperity of the country.
